newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares end mixed, focus again on second liners.
newsitem.headline: KL shares end mixed, focus again on second liners.

text.p: Share prices closed mixed with market focus again on second liner stocks as blue chips extended their consolidation after sharp gains earlier in the week, dealers said.
"It was another uneventful day as funds stayed on the sidelines," said one dealer. "Interest was very selective and price movements were slow throughout."
The benchmark Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange Composite Index ended at 1,119.48, down 1.28 points. The Second Board index closed up 6.43 points at 511.43.
Market volume was 176 million shares, with gainers beating losers 320 to 215.
Leading the fall in blue chips was Telekom Malaysia which dropped 30 cents to 21.80 ringgit.

Technology Resources fell five cents to 7.70 ringgit after reporting half-year earnings that were below market expectations. Maybank, however, rose 20 cents to 24.00 ringgit on the back of higher than expected full-year profits announced earlier this week.
Spot month August Composite Index futures closed up 2.0 points at 1,113.5. -- Syed Azman (603-230 8911)
